noun.description: A point or level which is a designated limit of something.
examples: 2,500 g is the standard cut-off below which infants are categorized as low birthweight
the cut-off date to register is July 2

noun.description: An act of stopping or interrupting the supply of something.
examples: a cut-off of aid would be a disaster

noun.description: Shorts made by cutting off the legs of a pair of jeans or other trousers and leaving the edges unhemmed.
